page.title: 05 HOUSING
page.content: Vernham Dean is an unusual village in that fifty percent of the houses have been built in the last fifteen years, offering a rural environment for people to live in a very pleasant part of Hampshire and commute daily to their place of work. Consequently the population is composed, for the greater part of young families with an average of two children living in their own detached houses. There is a small community of older retired people also living in their own( usually older type) houses. A small estate of local authority owned bungalows is provided for older people. There are also a few council owned semi_detached houses.
